title: JSON Schema for Azure DevOps Extensions

manifestVersion.title: A number corresponding to the version of the manifest format.

id.title: The extension's identifier
id.description: This is a string that must be unique among extensions from the same publisher.

version.title: A string specifying the version of an extension.
version.description: Should be in the format major.minor.patch, for example 0.1.2 or 1.0.0. You can also add a fourth number for the following format: 0.1.2.3

name.title: A short, human-readable name of the extension. Limited to 200 characters.

publisher.title: The identifier of the publisher.
publisher.description: This identifier must match the identifier the extension is published under.
publisher.$comment: This identifier must match the identifier the extension is published under.

categories.title: Array of strings representing the categories your extension belongs to.
categories.description: At least one category must be provided and there is no limit to how many categories you may include.

targets.title: The products and services supported by your integration or extension.

id.title: Installation targets: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/extend/develop/manifest?view=azure-devops#installation-targets
id.description: Id of the product or service which your integration/extension should support

version.title: Installation target versions: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/extend/develop/manifest?view=azure-devops#installation-targets
version.description: Some installation target identifiers, like and , support an optional version range. This further clarifies the supported releases the extension or integration is supported on.Microsoft.TeamFoundation.ServerMicrosoft.TeamFoundation.Server.Integration

demands.title: Capabilities required by your extension.

baseUri.description: (Optional) base URL for all relative URLs specified by the extension's contributions.

description.title: A few sentences describing the extension.
